titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Raoul Froger-Doudemont photograph collection BCMS.0057
titlestmt.author: Diana Bowers-Smith

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-21 11:22:17 +0000.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

physdesc.extent: in 65 digital photographic images in tiff format.

did.abstract: Black and white photographs by Raoul Froger-Doudement documenting street scenes in New York City and elsewhere from 1895-1901.
did.materialspec: The digitized portions of this collection are available here.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Raoul Froger-Doudemont collection (1895-1901) consists of 102 black and white prints, film positives and film negatives. Subjects include: Manhattan and Brooklyn street scenes, Flatiron building, waterfront, parades as well as images of Washington, D.C., Atlantic City and elsewhere.
78 original glass plate negatives from this collection were given to the Brooklyn Museum in June 1994.
65 images from this collection are available through the library's digital collections portal.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open to researchers without restriction. The physical collection is unprocessed but a portion of the collection is available through the library's digital collections portal.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: While many items in the Center for Brooklyn History are unrestricted, we do not own reproduction rights to all materials. Be aware of the several kinds of rights that might apply: copyright, licensing and trademarks. The researcher assumes all responsibility for copyright questions.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item/descriptive title, date (if known), call number (if applicable); Raoul Froger-Doudemont photograph collection, BCMS.0057; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Raoul Froger-Doudemont was an American photographer born in France in 1866 and active in the 1890s-1900s. He also worked with Eugene Wemlinger.
